As the son of a blacksmith, Henry learned a lot. With the right knowledge, skill and materials, you can forge axes, fangs and swords both long and short.
As the son of a blacksmith, Henry has learned a lot. With the right knowledge, skill and materials, he can forge axes, swords both long and short as well as hunting swords.

Where will you smith?
You can find a smithy in almost every village and the local smiths will let you use it for free. On the map it is marked with an anvil icon.

Where will you work?
You can find a smithy in almost every village, and the local smiths will let you use it for free. On the map it is marked with an anvil icon.

What will you forge?
You can find everything you can forge in the Crafting tab in the Player Menu. You can expand your knowledge by using recipes, which are found all over the world and you just need to learn them.
 
What will you forge?
To make each item you need the raw materials according to the recipe. Again, you get these in the world and these are materials, base and precious metals, components and fasteners.

What will you forge?
You can find everything you can forge in the Crafting tab in the Player Menu. You can expand your knowledge by learning new recipes which can be found throughout the world.
 
What materials will you use?
To make an item, you will first have to acquire the raw materials listed in the recipe. These too can be found throughout the world or bought, including various, components, and binding materials.
<label>Tip: Every good blacksmith wears a blacksmith's apron and gloves to work, and they certainly don't do it just for show.</label>
<label>Tip: Every good blacksmith wears a blacksmith's apron and gloves to work, and they certainly don't do it just for show.</label>
The journey of each of your products starts in the furnace, where the material needs to be heated to the right temperature.
The journey of each of your products starts in the furnace, where the material needs to be heated to the right temperature.

The temperature of the furnace is controlled by bellows. Longer products (such as swords) can be moved around in the furnace to heat different parts of the product.
 
As the temperature of the product increases, its colour changes. The ideal temperature for forging is when the product reaches a straw yellow colour. You can check the colour better if you examine the product closely.
 
If you overdo it with heating the material of the product loses strength and deteriorates. You can tell by the product cracking and sparks flying out of it.
 
Once you've got the heat up, you can move on to the anvil.

You can control the forge's temperature using the bellow. Certain long pieces (such as swords) can be moved around in the forge to heat different parts.
 
As the workpiece heats up, its colour will change, ideal state is when the workpiece reaches a straw yellow colour. You can check the workpiece's colour by examining it up close.
 
If you overheat it, you'll know by the sparks that start flying off the item.
 
Once your workpiece is properly heated, you can move it to the anvil.

$blacksmith_use_forgebag; you blow the bellows
{$blacksmith_mouse_x;|$blacksmith_gamepad_x;} move the product in the furnace
$blacksmith_inspection; look at the product

$blacksmith_use_forgebag; to blow the bellows
{$blacksmith_mouse_x;|$blacksmith_gamepad_x;} to move the workpiece around in the forge
$blacksmith_inspection; look inspect the workpiece
<label>Sparking white means the product is too hot</label>
<label>White hot means the product is too hot</label>
<label>Straw yellow is the colour of a properly heated product</label>
<label>Straw yellow means the workpiece is properly heated</label>
<label>Orange and red shades indicate that the product is not yet hot enough</label>
<label>Shades of orange and red indicate the workpiece isn't hot enough</label>
You create the final shape of the product on the anvil by hitting the product with a hammer.
You create the final shape of the piece by hammering it on the anvil.

The more you pull with the hammer, the stronger the blow, but the more strenght it costs you. With your other hand you can move the product around the anvil to change which part you are forging. You can also rotate the product.
 
The goal is to forge so that your strikes are as effective as possible and move you towards the final shape. You can tell the quality of the strike by the amount of sparks, and an experienced smith also listens to how the strike sounds.
 
What to watch out for
The product cools as you work, and forging a product that is not at the optimal temperature will reduce the effectiveness of the strike. If you feel the product has cooled, return to the forge.

The further you pull back the hammer, the harder you'll strike it, but the more Energy it'll cost you. You can use your other hand to move and rotate the workpiece around on the anvil so you can hammer different parts of it.
 
The goal is to hammer the workpiece as effectively as possible while forming the final shape of the piece. You can tell the quality of the strike by the amount of sparks, and an experienced blacksmith also pays attention to how the strike sounds.
 
What to watch out for
The workpiece will cool as you work, and hammering a workpiece that isn't properly heated will reduce the effectiveness of your hammer strikes. If it seems the workpiece has cooled, return it to the forge.

by holding $blacksmith_stroke~; stretch the hammer
by dropping $blacksmith_stroke; strike the hammer
{$blacksmith_mouse_x;|$blacksmith_gamepad_x;} moving the product

hold $blacksmith_stroke~; to pull back the hammer
release $blacksmith_stroke; to strike
{$blacksmith_mouse_x;|$blacksmith_gamepad_x;} to move the workpiece

Try to forge along the entire length of the product and don't forget to turn it around.
 
Keep the rhythm and watch the power of your strokes to keep you breathing. When you get into a rhythm, Henry starts whistling and everything goes better when you whistle.

Try to hammer along the entire length of the workpiece and don't forget to turn it around every now and then.
 
Keep the rhythm and pay attention to the strength of your blows, so that you don't run out of breath. When you get into a rhythm, Henry will start whistling, and everything goes better when you whistle.
<label>Tip: The best blacksmiths know that temperature, uniformity and rhythm are essential for quality work.<label>
<label>Tip: The best blacksmiths know that temperature, uniformity and rhythm are essential for quality work.</label>
When the product is finished, Jindra will know it and suggest its clouding himself.
When the piece is finished, Henry will suggest quenching it.

Jindra will do the final hardening himself. He heats the product again and cools it rapidly. This makes the final product harder and more durable.
 
After hardening the product, you will see how good a product you have made. Well processed products are of higher quality and can also be sold at a higher price.

Henry will do the final quenching himself. He'll heat up the workpiece one last time, then rapidly cool it. This makes the final product harder and more durable.
 
Once the piece is quenched, you'll see what Quality you managed to make it. Well-made pieces will be of a higher Quality, and can be sold at a higher price.

The bow is a quick and effective weapon at long range, but handling it requires training. Aiming can be difficult, as holding a drawn bowstring drains your stamina and as it depletes, your hands will start to shake.

The bow is a quick and effective weapon at long range, but handling it requires training. Aiming can be difficult, as holding a bowstring drawn drains your stamina and as it depletes, your hands will start to shake.
To shoot, you must have arrows equipped in your Ammunition slot.
To shoot, you must have arrows equipped in your Ammunition slot.
High charisma comes in handy when you need to look good, impress or make an impression.
A high Charisma level can come in handy when trying to look distinguished or make a good impression.

Charisma of items
Charisma is expressed by two numbers (e.g. 8/10) for an item. The first shows its current charisma/the second its maximum charisma. Its current charisma is affected by its condition and dirtyness.
 

 
Calculating Charisma
Total Charisma is calculated from the values of each piece of your clothing. However, some pieces of clothing are more important than others.

Item Charisma
An item's Charisma is represented by two numbers (e.g. 8/10). The first represents its current Charisma while the second represents its maximum Charisma. Its current Charisma is affected by its condition and dirtiness.
 

 
Calculating Charisma
Your total Charisma is calculated from the values of each piece of your clothing. However, some pieces of clothing are more important than others.
<label>The biggest influence on your overall Charisma are the biggest pieces of clothing. So what you wear over your torso and over your legs.
<label>The bigger the item of clothing, the greater the influence it has on your total Charisma - essentially, the items you wear on your torso and legs.</label>
Attacking the correct zones and blocking
Attacking the correct zones and blocking are considered more advanced combat techniques.
Holding down the block button will allow you deflect attacks from all opponents in front of you. However, a succesful block costs stamina, therefore you're unableto defend yourself without it.

Holding down the block {button|button|button} will allow you block attacks from all opponents in front of you. However, a successful block costs stamina, so you'll be unable to defend yourself without it.
Blocking at the right time will interrupt your opponent's attack, allowing you to retaliate.
Blocking at the right time will interrupt your opponent's attack, allowing you to retaliate.
After a Perfect block, you can follow with a counterattack - a riposte.
After a Perfect block, you can follow with a counterattack - a riposte.
If you want to avoid an opponent's Perfect block, attack in the direction furthest away from your opponent's weapon.
If you want to avoid an opponent's Perfect block, attack in the direction furthest away from your opponent's weapon.

When you attack in the direction your opponent's weapon is, the chance of him performing a Perfect block significantly increases. The stronger your opponent, the higher the chance of him blocking your attack.

When you attack in the direction your opponent's weapon is, the chance of him performing a Perfect block significantly increases. The stronger your opponent, the higher the chance of him blocking your attack.
If an opponent deflects your attack and continues with a riposte, you can deflect it with your own Perfect block! Alternating attacks and counter attacks form the core of swordfighting.
If an opponent deflects your attack and continues with a riposte, you can deflect it with your own Perfect block! Alternating attacks and counter attacks form the core of swordfighting.

The most effective way to fight is to chain attacks into longer sequences and combos. For attacks to chain properly, they must be performed in quick succession. Maker sure to attack again as soon as your strikes lands!

The most effective way to fight is to chain attacks into longer sequences and combos. For attacks to chain properly, they must be performed in quick succession. Make sure to attack again as soon as your strike lands!

How to properly chain a basic combo
A basic combo consists of an attack
from above > from the right > from the left

Properly chaining a basic combo
A basic combo consists of an attack
from above > from the right > from the left
After an attack, your weapon will automatically end up in the left position.
After an attack, your weapon will automatically end up in the left position.
{$combat_zone_mouse_x;|$xi_rotateyaw;} to move your weapon to the right
{$combat_zone_mouse_x;|$xi_rotateyaw;} to move your weapon to the right
The next attack must come from the right, so move your weapon there (the brighter colour of the rosette hints at the direction)
The next attack must come from the right, so move your weapon there (the brighter colour of the rosette hints at the direction).
After an attack, your weapon will automatically end up in the left position.
After an attack, your weapon will automatically end up in the left position.
The final attack should come from the left, and your weapon is already there, so you just have to attack
The final attack should come from the left, and your weapon is already there, so you just have to attack.

Stamina
Attacks that don't pierce your opponent's armour will reduce their stamina. Once they're out of stamina, they'll start taking damage to their health.
 
A Perfect block doesn't cost any stamina. Sometimes it comes in handy to only defend using Perfect blocks without performing ripostes, and thus regenerate your stamina.

Stamina
Attacks that don't pierce your opponent's armour will reduce their stamina. Once they're out of stamina, they'll start taking damage to their health.
 
A Perfect block doesn't cost any stamina. Sometimes it comes in handy to only defend using Perfect blocks without performing ripostes, and thus regenerate your stamina.

Armour
Where on your opponent your strikes land is important. For example, a blow to the head is much more effeective than a blow to the arm.
 
Different types of armour have different resistances to different sorts of weapons. For example, sword won't do much damage to plate armour, but a mace will.
 
Using special techniques(such as Master strikes and combos) will allow you to find weak points in even the strongest sets of armour.

Armour
Where on your opponent your strikes land is important. For example, a blow to the head is much more effective than a blow to the arm.
 
Different types of armour have different resistances to different sorts of weapons. For example, sword won't do much damage to plate armour, but a mace will.
 
Using special techniques (such as Master strikes and combos) will allow you to find weak points in even the strongest sets of armour.

Stat requirements
Every weapon requires a certain amount of Strength and Agility to use properly. If your stats aren't high enough, attacking with the weapon won't be very effective.
 
On the other hand, if your Strength is higher than the weapon requires, your attacks will be stronger.
 
Your Agility level effects how much stamina attacks will cost.

Stat requirements
Every weapon requires a certain amount of Strength and Agility to use properly. If your stats aren't high enough, attacking with the weapon won't be very effective.
 
On the other hand, if your Strength is higher than the weapon requires, your attacks will be stronger.
 
Your Agility level affects how much stamina attacks will cost.
Combos are the most effective attacks. To perform a combo, you have to chain attacks one after another. You have to initiate the next attack as soon as your weapon hits your opponent or their weapon.
Combos are the most effective attacks. To perform a combo, you have to chain attacks one after another. You have to initiate the next attack as soon as your weapon hits your opponent or their weapon.
Every one of your actions has consequences. If you commit crimes, the world and people around you will react to them.
Every one of your actions has consequences. If you commit crimes, the world around you and its people will react to them.

Anything that an honest person should avoid is considered a crime. So he should not kill innocents, steal, break into other people's homes, hurt people or domestic animals, and disturb their peaceful lives.

Anything an honest Christian should avoid is considered a crime. One must not kill innocents, steal, break into other people's homes, harm people or domestic animals, and disturb their peaceful lives.

If anyone catches you committing a crime, they will report you to the guards or engage in a confrontation themselves.
 
You are not safe even when no one sees you directly during the crime. People aren't stupid, and they may figure out that it's your work.
 
So if you're standing covered in blood next to a dead body, or moving around a house that's been robbed, you'll be discovered.

If someone catches you committing a crime, they will report you to the guards or engage in a confrontation themselves.
 
You aren't safe even if no one catches you red-handed. People aren't stupid, and they might deduce it was you who did it.
You can find your reputation information on the player tab {$open_apse_player; |}in bookmark Reputation
You can find your information about your reputation in the Player card {$open_apse_player; |}under the Reputation tab.

Reputation affects how people treat you. If someone likes you, they'll say hello, and maybe a merchant will give you a discount. On the other hand, if they hate you, they may not even talk to you.
 
You improve your reputation by doing tasks. You make it worse by committing crimes and acting dishonestly.
 
The way you behave spreads among people, so if you help or hurt one person, it will soon be heard by others in the area.

Reputation affects how people treat you. If someone likes you, they'll greet you kindly, and merchants may even give you discounts. On the other hand, if they hate you, they may not even talk to you.
 
You can improve your reputation by completing tasks. You can make it worse by committing crimes and acting dishonestly.
 
The way you behave spreads among people, so if you help or hurt one person, others in the area will soon hear about it.
A bad reputation can always be remedied by paying an indulgence or a Penitant pilgrimage, which can be imposed by a priest.
A bad reputation can always be remedied by paying an indulgence or a Penitant pilgrimage, which can be imposed by a priest.
If there's a lot of crime going on in an area, people become more vigilant, arm themselves, and guards call in reinforcements. Once things have been quiet for a while, things will return to normal.

If there's a lot of crime going on in an area, people will become more vigilant, arm themselves, and guards will call in reinforcements. Once things have been settled down, everything will return to normal.
If something suspicious happens, people will search the area.
When something suspicious happens, people will search the area around them.
If a crime is discovered and you are exposed as the perpetrator, people will try to track you down.
If a crime is discovered and you're found to be the perpetrator, people will try to track you down.
When someone sees you, they try to recognize you first. The degree of recognition is indicated by the rabbit's ears.
When somebody spots you, they will first try to recognise you. The level of recognition is indicated by the hare's ears.
Once you are detected, the observer will move closer to detect you.
Once you are detected, the observer will move closer to detect you.
An icon will alert you to the detection.
The hare icon will alert you if you are detected.
Someone can fire you from places you're not supposed to be.
If you're found in a place you aren't supposed to be, you may be kicked out.
If you're seen committing a crime, people will want to report you.
If you're seen committing a crime, people will try to report you to the guards.
You can be arrested or otherwise confronted for crimes.
You can be arrested or otherwise confronted for your crimes.
You're in a fight, but there's no immediate threat near you. In such a situation, you can bandage and heal directly from your inventory.
You're in combat, but there's no immediate threat to you. In such situations, you can bandage or otherwise heal yourself directly from your inventory.
You are in combat and in immediate danger. You must defend yourself or run.
You're in combat, and in immediate danger. You have to decide whether to fight or flee.
Commiting crimes has consequences. If you get caught by the guards, they'll want to punish you. You then have several options.
Commiting crimes has consequences. If you get caught by the guards, they'll want to punish you. You then have several options.
If you have enough money to pay the fine, you can redeem yourself of your crimes.
If you have enough money to pay the fine, you can redeem yourself of your crimes.
Depending on the severity and number of crimes, you are subject to punishment you can decide to accept.
Depending on the severity and number of crimes, you are subject to punishment you can decide to accept.
You can try to convince the guard you're innocent, but it may not work out.
You can try to convince the guard you're innocent, but it may not work out.
If you decide to run away, the guards will attack you.
If you decide to run away, the guards will attack you.
$open_crime_list; will display a list of your crimes
$open_crime_list; will display a list of your crimes
Acceptance of punishment will have consequences that will harm you in some way. These will wear off over time or by embarking on a Penitant pilgrimage.
Acceptance of punishment will have consequences that will harm you in some way. These will wear off over time or by embarking on a Penitant pilgrimage.
You'll spend a few days in the pillory, and the public humiliation will make it temporarily difficult for you to deal with people.
You'll spend a few days in the pillory, and the public humiliation will make it temporarily difficult for you to deal with people.
You will be caned, which will take a toll on your health and will make you weaker for some time.
You will be caned, which will take a toll on your health and will make you weaker for some time.
The executioner branded you on the neck. Until the wound heals, people will treat you like a criminal and an outcast.
The executioner branded you on the neck. Until the wound heals, people will treat you like a criminal and an outcast.
Execution is reserved as punishment for the most severe crimes and will mark the end of your earthly pilgrimage. Only a recently branded criminal can be executed.
Execution is reserved as punishment for the most severe crimes and will spell the end of your earthly pilgrimage. Only a recently branded criminal can be executed.

Loading a crossbow takes longer than drawing a bow, but aiming is much easier and barely costs any stamina. Besides that, you can load a bolt in advance and have a crossbow ready to fire at a moment's notice.
Loading a crossbow takes longer than drawing a bow, but aiming is much easier and barely costs any stamina. Besides that, you can load a bolt in advance and be ready to fire at a moment's notice.
To shoot, you must have bolts equipped in your Ammunition slot.
To shoot, you must have bolts equipped in your Ammunition slot.
I've you're interested in gambling, you can find a game of dice in every respectable tavern.
If you're interested in gambling, you can find a game of dice in any respectable tavern.
If you and your opponent both have the same type of badge, you can play a game where you can take advantage of its benefits.
If you and your opponent both have the same type of badge, you can play a game where you can take advantage of its benefits.

If you have any of your dice in your inventory, you can choose to use any of them before the game. Most of your dice have "special properties" which you can read in their descriptions. These allow you to tactically play your luck.

If you have any dice in your inventory, you can choose to use them before starting the game. Most dice have special properties that you can read about in their descriptions. These allow you to use special techniques to improve your luck.

You start the game by rolling all six dice. Select the scoring dice you want keep (put them to the side and gain points for them at the end of your turn), then roll the rest again. You can keep rolling until you run out of dice.
 
However, if you don't roll a single scoring die, you lose all points gained this turn.
 
The art of dice is to finish your turn and score your points before you run the risk of not rolling a single scoring die.
 
The first player to reach the score goal is the victor. You can see all point information for the current game in the bottom left corner.

You start the game by rolling all six dice. Select the scoring dice you want to keep (put them to the side and gain points for them at the end of your turn), then roll the rest again. You can keep rolling until you run out of dice.
 
However, if you don't roll a single scoring die, you lose all points gained this turn.
 
The art of dice is to finish your turn and score your points before you run the risk of not rolling a single scoring die.
 
The first player to reach the score goal is the victor. You can see all point information for the current game in the bottom left corner.
The whole art of dice is to end the round and write down your points before you run the risk of not scoring any points.
The art of dice is to end the round and thus score your points before you run the risk of not scoring any more.
The first person to record the specified number of points wins. You can see all the information about the game in the bottom left corner.
The first person to score the set number of points wins. You can see all the information about the game in the bottom left corner.

You can make an ordinary game of dice more interesting by using a badge.

If you and your opponent have a badge of the same level (tin, silver or golden), you can make use of them during your game.

You can find these properties in the badge's description in your inventory, or you can read them at any time on the following page.

Help an enigmatic artist finish the most important painting of his life, reveal his mysterious past and channel your creativity into shield painting on an adventure spanning from the wild forests of the Trosky region to the bustling metropolis of Kuttenberg.

Bathhouses in the Kingdom of Bohemia are regarded not only for their beautiful bathmaids, but also their skilled barbers that can turn any common vagrant into a dashing cavalier. For a small fee, of course.

Prove your riding and shooting skills and settle the feud between two nomads. Take part in mounted archery, where good aim and quick observation win the day, or take off in a cross-country race to test your horse's stamina and knowledge of the Trosky region.

Your dog's name is Mutt and if you take good care of him, he'll obey you, help you while hunting, tracking, even in combat.
Your dog's name is Mutt and if you take good care of him, he'll obey you, help you while hunting, tracking, even in combat.

You can find information about your dog in the Player tab under bookmark Companions. The main thing is Mutt's Obedience. A higher number means he is stronger, better at fighting and more determined to help you.

You can find information about your dog in the Player card under the Sidekicks tab. The most important thing is Mutt's Obedience level. A higher level means he is stronger, better at fighting and more determined to help you.
With low obedience, his strength and determination will drop and he may ignore some commands. If obedience drops to zero, he runs away and you have to wait until he comes back on his own.

With a low Obedience level, Mutt's strength and determination will decrease and he may ignore some commands. If obedience drops to zero, he will run away and you'll have to wait until he comes back on his own.
You can raise your dog's Obedience by praising him, feeding him and generally paying attention to him. It will lower if you hit him in battle or you don't feed him for a while.

By holding $call^; Mutt will attack the person you are looking at, if you have your weapon drawn, you're in combat or in a crouch.

A new immersive game mode in which navigation, survival and combat are more difficult and more realistic. At the start of Hardcore mode, you also have to select at least three negative perks which further modify the games difficulty in different areas.

The compass and location indicator on the map - carefully observe your surroundings to find your way around, or you can ask the locals for directions

When in combat, your cursor will lock onto your opponent. This allows you to select one of four attack zones. In hardcore mode, you can tell which attack zone you have selected based on the position of your character's hands.
 
When using a sword, the top and side zones are used for slashing attacks and the bottom zone for stabs. Blunt and polearm weapons only use the top and side zones. When unarmed, the side zones are used for punches and the bottom zone is for kicks.

When in combat, your cursor will lock onto your opponent. This allows you to select one of four attack zones. In Hardcore mode, you can tell which attack zone you have selected based on the position of your character's hands.
 
When using a sword, the top and side zones are used for slashing attacks and the bottom zone for stabs. Blunt and polearm weapons only use the top and side zones. When unarmed, the side zones are used for punches and the bottom zone is for kicks.

If instead of holding down the block button you press it at the start of your opponent's attack, you'll perform a perfect block, which will interrupt your opponent and allow you to follow up with a riposte.

Hardcore mode is an immersive gameplay mode which mainly influences your user interface and the way you navigate the world.

Negative perks

You can't see your position on the map, so you'll have to use your surroundings to find your way around. If you're lost, you can always ask someone where you are. Just walk up to them, use $chat_focus_follow_init_press~; and ask. That is, if you didn't choose the Bashful perk of course!

Combat and survival
Your health and stamina bars are hidden in hardcore mode, and you have to rely on sight and sound to orientate yourself on the battlefield. When your opponent is injured, he'll be bloodied. If he's tired, he'll breathe heavily. The same goes for your character!
 
In combat, you don't see your combat rosette or perfect block and riposte indicators. You have to rely on you and your opponent's movements.

Henry, setting forth to new lands by Hans Capon's side, isn't the lad he used to be. His adventurous life has taken a toll on him.
Henry, setting forth towards new lands by Hans Capon's side, isn't the lad he used to be. His adventurous life has taken a toll on him.

Hardcore mode is a more difficult and immersive way of experiencing the game. Helpful UI elements are limited both in and out of combat, and navigating the world relies solely on your sense of direction. Your character is never marked on the map, the compass doesn't show you cardinal directions, and fast travel is disabled.
 
You can also adjust the difficulty in different areas by selecting at least three negative perks that remain active throughout the game:

Miraculously, you survived the terrible fall, but you lost several Main Level, Skill and Perk points due to your extensive injuries. You have no choice but to recover and regain them gradually later in the game.
A fast horse is a great companion that will ease your travels and provide you with a tactical advantage while mounted.
A fast horse is a great companion that will ease your travels and provide you with a tactical advantage while mounted.
A horse can travel at three speeds: Trot, canter and gallop. Just spur it on and it will accelerate. You can see what speed you're riding at by the icon above your stamina bar.
A horse can travel at three speeds: Trot, canter and gallop. Just spur it on and it will speed up. You can see what speed you're riding at by the icon above your stamina bar.
A horse's stamina works similarly to Henry's. While it has it, it can travel at its maximum speed. If you spur it without the necessary stamina, it will buck you off.
A horse's stamina works the same as Henry's. While it has stamina to spend, it can travel at maximum speed. If you spur it on while its stamina bar is empty, it will buck you off.

$call; to call your horse
$mount_horse; to mount
$sprint; to speed up
$horse_slowdown; to slow down
$horse_dismount; to dismount
{$moveback;|hold reverse} + $jump; to rear up

Your horse's resolve determines how long it will gallop on its own before slowing down. Every spur raises your horses resolve slightly, but if you keep spurring it on over its maximum capacity, it won't speed up any more and might buck you off.

Your horse's resolve determines how long it will gallop on its own before slowing down. Every spur raises your horse's resolve slightly, but if you keep spurring it on over its maximum capacity, it won't speed up any more and might buck you off.
If you ride along a path, you won't have to turn. Your horse can follow the path on its own.
If you ride along a path, you won't have to turn. Your horse will follow the path on its own.
Just like Henry, your horse has its own inventory, and using horse tack you can increase its capabilities.
Just like Henry, your horse has its own inventory, and equipping a horse tack allows you to increase its capabilities.
Your horses inventory is one of the tabs in Henry's inventory and it is available whenever your horse is.
Your horse's inventory is one of the tabs in Henry's inventory and it is available whenever your horse is.
It is possible to transfer items from Henry's inventory to the saddlebag to relieve yourself of items that are not needed now. Simply mark the item of your choice and move it to your horse.
You can transfer items from Henry's inventory to your saddle bag to relieve yourself of the weight of items you don't currently need. Simply select the item of your choice and move it to your horse.

Horses can be equipped with collars, harness, shoes or saddle. The equipment affects the horse's ability and makes the horse faster, more able to carry or less shy.
 
Move the horse's equipment into the horse's saddlebag and from there it can be put on the horse.

Horses can be equipped with a bridle, harness, horseshoes and a saddle. Equipment affects the horse's abilities, can make it faster, able to carry more, or even less likely to spook.
 
To equip horse tack, it must first be moved to its saddle bag.
$move_item; move the item to the horse bag and back
$move_item; move item to saddle bag or back

The Player Menu is where you can find all sorts of important information about Henry and the surrounding world.
It is divided into six sections, between which you can move to the right and left. You can see which section of the Player Menu you are in in the upper signpost.

If you have selected an item that affects Henry's stats, you can see it here.
Putting on armour has a few important rules that must be followed. Properly assembled armour will protect you best.
Putting on armour has a few important rules that must be followed. Properly assembled armour will protect you the best.
You must always wear head protection such as a balaclava, coif or hood under your helmet. The helmet itself protects you from being cut, but the head protection absorbs the impact.
You must always wear additional head protection under your helmet, such as a coif or hood. The helmet itself will protect you from being cut, while the protection undernearth absorbs heavy impacts.
Gambeson is a thick, long, padded shirt that forms a cushioning layer between your body and the metal of the armor that protects you.
A gambeson is a long, thick, padded shirt that forms a cushioning layer between your body and the metal of the armour that protects you.
Like a gambeson, quilted legs create a soft layer between your body and the plates on your legs.
Like a gambeson, quilted hose create a soft layer between your body and the plates on your legs.
In order to put your spurs on properly, you must wear shoes.
To properly use spurs, you must first put on some shoes.
You can create three Outfits for different occasions in the inventory and switch between them easily.
You can create three Outfits for different occasions in the inventory and switch between them on the fly.
Each Outfit is marked with its coat of arms and every item you are equipped with in that Outfit is marked the same way.
Each Outfit is marked with its coat of arms and every item you are equipped with in that Outfit is marked the same way.
<label>Multiple coats of arms on an item means that you have it in multiple Outfits.</label>
<label>Multiple coats of arms on an item means that you have it equipped in multiple Outfits.</label>
Thanks to Outfits you can create canvas armour for close combat, quiet outfits for quiet work or handsome clothes to make a good impression on Jindra.
Using Outfits, you can create a full plate armour set for close combat, a sneaking outfit for stealthy business, or even a dapper ensemble for when you want Henry to make a good impression.

Weapons, armour and clothing exist in different qualities. These are signified on the item with coloured seals.
Weapons, armour and clothing exist in different qualities. These are signified on the item with coloured seals.
The same item of lower quality is worse in all aspect (strength, price, durability, etc.)
The same item of lower quality is worse in all aspects (strength, price, durability, etc.).

There's also a unique fourth quality, Henry's quality, that can only be made by you using the "Secret of Martin the blacksmith" perk in the Skills tab, under the Crafting tab.
 
Weapons of this quality deal more damage, are more durable and valuable than others.

There's also a unique fourth quality, Henry's quality, that can only be made by you using the "Secret of Martin the blacksmith" perk in the Skills tab, under the Crafting tab.
 
Weapons of this quality deal more damage, are more durable and valuable than others.

In battle, your equipment degrades and thus loses durability. If you don't repair it and let its durability drop to zero, your equipment may become irreparably damaged, and its quality will be permanently lowered

In battle, your equipment degrades and thus loses durability. If you don't repair it and let its durability drop to zero, your equipment may become irreparably damaged, and its quality will be permanently lowered.
If your piece of equipment's durability is now, you will be alerted with an icon next to your health bar.
If your piece of equipment's durability is low, you will be alerted with an icon next to your health bar.
It's good to repair your equipment, so that its quality doesn't drop. Breaking a weapon or shield of the lowest quality will cause it to be broken permanently!
It's good to repair your equipment, so that its quality doesn't drop. Breaking a weapon or shield of the lowest quality will cause it to be broken permanently!
Your premium items have been successfully added to your shared stash. Enjoy your new gear and happy adventuring!
Your premium items have been successfully added to your shared stash. Enjoy your new gear and happy adventuring!
You can start digging out by holding $trigger_use_hold^; if you have a packer in your inventory.
You can start lockpicking by holding $trigger_use_hold^; if you have a lockpick in your inventory.
Use the cursor size to find the right position of the key. When the cursor grows gold, you have found it.
Use the cursor size to find the correct lockpick position. The cursor will turn gold when you're in the right spot.
Start rotating the whole lock with $lock_dir_fwd; and keep the key in the right position {$lock_cursor_x;|$xi_lock_cursor_y;}. The difficulty depends on the complexity of the lock.
Start rotating the whole lock with $lock_dir_fwd; and keep the lockpick in the right position {$lock_cursor_x;|$xi_lock_cursor_y;}. The difficulty depends on the complexity of the lock.
Turn until the lock is unlocked.
Turn until the lock is open.

A masterful attack is an attack from the opposite direction from which the opponent is attacking, within the time window for a perfect block.
The Master strike is an attack from the opposite direction to your opponent's attack within the time window for a Perfect block.

If the enemy is attacking from the left, the moment you can make a perfect block, you attack from the right.
 
To attack from the right, you counterattack from the left. Against a jab, you go with an attack from above, and against an enemy attack from above, you go with a jab.

If the enemy is attacking from the left, the moment you can perform a Perfect block, attack from the right.
 
When your opponent attacks from the right, you counterattack from the left. If he goes for a stab, you counter with an attack from above, and against an enemy attack from above, go for a stab.

Suchdol is liberated and the army of the Wenceslas forces under the command of Jobst of Luxembourg and Radzig Kobyla marches to Prague. The Sigismund coalition breaks up and Otto von Bergov's Praguers negotiate a truce.
Together with Zizka's band, you are back in Devil's Den.
 
If you wish, you can return to completing unfinished side quests and exploring Kuttenberg and Trosky region.

Suchdol is liberated and the Wenceslas' forces under the command of Jobst of Luxembourg and Radzig Kobyla march to Prague. The pro-Sigismund coalition has fallen apart, and Otto von Bergow's Praguers are negotiating a truce.
Together with Zizka's band, you are back in Devil's Den.
 
If you wish, you can return to completing unfinished side quests and exploring the Kuttenberg and Trosky regions.
You will be given the option to rob if you sneak up on the victim and focus on the bag hanging from their belt. The pickpocketing minigame then consists of two phases.
You'll be given the option to pickpocket someone when you sneak up on them and focus on the pouch hanging from their belt. The pickpocketing mini-game then consists of two phases.

Phase One: Searching in the pouch
By searching the pouch, you're collecting the time needed to steal things later, but beware! When the center of the lunette starts to turn red, the chances of the victim discovering you go up.
 
Also, make sure that the victim and anyone nearby doesn't see you while you're searching. This would thwart your theft.

Phase One: Searching a pouch
By searching the pouch, you accumulate time needed to steal things later, but beware! When the centre of the lunette starts to turn red, the chances of the victim noticing you go up.
 
Also, make neither the victim nor anyone nearby see you feeling around in their purse, as this will thwart your pickpocketing attempt.
By holding $charge; you're searching for victims in the bag
<label>Minimum amount of time you have to accumulate in order to start stealing.</label>
<label>Minimum amount of time you have to accumulate in order to start stealing.</label>
<label>The accumulated time you will have available to you when pulling out stealing items.</label>
<label>The accumulated time you have for pulling out stolen items.</label>
<label>The redder the center of the lunette, the more likely the victim is to notice you.</label>
<label>The redder the center of the lunette, the more likely the victim is to notice you.</label>
Once you've successfully stalked your victim, you can start stealing. But you only have a limited time before he notices you and foils your heist.
Once you've successfully searched your victim, you can start stealing, but you only have a limited time before they notice you and foils your plan.

Second Phase: Stealing Items
Move the lunette between the slots and mark the items you want to steal. Each marked item takes a chunk out of your remaining time.
 
To avoid being detected by the victim, you must pull your hand out before your time runs out. A slot at 12 o'clock with a picture of an open door is used to pull your hand out, even with all the marked items.
 
Some people have two bags. One in the front and one in the back. In the top half of the lunette, you can then see the items from the bag you were aiming at when you started robbing. And in the lower part, you see the items from the other bag.

Second Phase: Stealing items
You can move around the lunette to select the items you want to steal. Every selected item takes a chunk out of your remaining time.
 
To avoid being detected by the victim, you must pull your hand out before your time runs out. A slot at 12 o'clock with a picture of an open door is used to pull your hand out, along with all the items you've selected.
 
Some people have two pouches - one in the front and one in the back. In the top half of the lunette, you can then see the items from the pouch you were aiming at when you started robbing. In the lower part, you see the items from the other pouch.

The guest orders the wine - Tokaji (white) or Monastery (red) - by calling out to you and raising their hand.
 
If you are unsure, you can ask them to repeat the order.

A guest will order wine - either Tokaji (white) or Monastery (red) - by calling out to you and raising their hand.
 
If you're unsure, you can ask them to repeat their order.

On the table in the corner you'll find two pitchers of wine. Take the one that one of the guests wants to pour and walk to his table with the pitcher. The chat will activate the option to pour wine for him.
 
After serving the guest, you can return the pitcher or wait to see if the next guest wants the same wine.

On the table in the corner of the room you'll find two pitchers of wine. Take the one that one of the guests wants to pour and walk to his table with the pitcher. The chat will activate the option to pour wine for him.
 
After serving the guest, you can return the pitcher or wait to see if the next guest wants the same wine.

Be careful not to let guests wait too long or pour them a wine they didn't order.
 
Repeated delays or mistakes won't be tolerated,

When the green shield icon appears in the combat rosette, press the block key to perform a Perfect Block that doesn't cost any stamina!

One of the most important aspects of combat is stamina.
Every attack and block costs stamina, and it will recharge when idle. If you use up all your stamina, you won't be able to attack or defend effectively.

For the next 20 minutes, you will immersive yourself in the world of KCD2, a realistic RPG that takes place at the start of the 15th century in medieval Bohemia.

You're Henry, and together with your companion Hans Capon, you managed to escape a forest full of enemies. Capon put his own life at stake to save you, but he's wounded himself and will need your help.

Playing as Henry, you can experience our new shield painting feature from the upcoming DLC Brushes with Death. You can unlock more customisation options for your shield by completing various quests and activities.
Putting on the bag opens slots in which you can insert the electricals and food you need to have on hand. These can then be quickly consumed in combat.
Equipping a pouch will open up slots that you place potions and food into. You can then quickly consume these during combat.
The maximum number of slots you can have is four, but not every bag will open all of them.
The maximum number of slots you can have is four, but not every pouch will allow you to use all of them.

The maximum number of slots you can have is four. One by default and up to three additional ones depending on the belt you wear.

One weapon, shield or ammunition can be equipped in multiple slots, allowing you to create variable weapon sets. For example, you can combine one shield with different weapons, such as sword & shiled, axe & shield, etc.

In the Player tab of the Player Menu, you can find all important information about Henry's stats, abilities, and current status.
In the Player Tab, you can find all important information about Henry's stats, abilities, and current status.

Throughout the game you earn "Perk Points" which you can use to improve your Stats, Skills and Fight.
 
In the other tabs, you'll find Buffs that can temporarily affect Henry's status, find Reputation in locations you've already visited, recall Combos or the status of your Animal Companions.

Throughout the game, you'll earn "Perk Points" which you can use to improve your Stats, Skills and Warfare capabilities.
 
In the other tabs, you'll find Buffs that can temporarily affect Henry's status, your Reputation in places you've been, recall Combos, or check the status of your Animal Companions.
If a regular person catches you committing a crime, they may want to deal with you on their own, without calling the guards. You have several options for what to do.
If a ordinary person catches you committing a crime, they may try to deal with you on their own, without calling the guards. You have several options for what to do.
If you have enough money to compensate the other party, you can settle the dispute.
If you have enough money to compensate the other party, you can settle the dispute.
You will go together to the magistrate, who will, according to the gravity of your crimes, mete out your punishment.
You will go together to the local bailiff who judge you based on the severity of your crimes
You can try to convince the victim of your innocence, but like all persuasion, it may not succeed.
You can try to persuade the victim of your innocence, but like all persuasion, it may not succeed.
If you decide to leave, the victim will attack or run for the guards.
If you decide to leave, the victim will attack you or run for the guards.
On the grinding wheel you can repair your stabbing and slashing weapons. This will save you money on repairs at a dealer or repair kit.

The shop consists of two parts. The merchant's offer for buying goods and Jindra's inventory for selling them.
The shop screen consists of two parts. The merchant's inventory for buying goods and Henry's inventory for selling them.

Selected items to buy and sell are placed in the basket whose contents can be viewed in the upper right corner under the "Cart tab."
 
The bottom bar will give you information about the transaction in progress, such as how much money you or the merchant have, or what the aggregate price is for all items in the cart.
 
You can then buy at the listed price, or try to haggle with the merchant on the price.

Selected items to buy and sell are placed in your basket, the contents of which can be viewed in the upper right corner under the "Basket tab."
 
The bottom bar will display information about the current transaction, such as how much money you and the merchant have and the total price for all the items in your basket.
 
You can then buy them at the listed price, or try haggling with the merchant.

$move_left; $move_right; move between buying and selling
$action; mark an item and add it to the cart
$close_deal; close the transaction
Hold $haggle^; negotiate the price

The Persuasion skill is influenced by your Stats and Skills. You can find detailed desciptions in your inventory, under the Player tab.
The Persuasion skill is influenced by your other Stats and Skills. You can find detailed descriptions in your inventory, under the Player tab.

You can solve a lot of situations by convincing the other side. In dialogues you will have a choice of some of the options below that define how you will react, but beware! Persuasion requires the other party to believe you.
Many situations can be solved by reasoning with the other party. Within dialogues, you'll have several options of how to react. But be warned, the other party won't always believe you!

<strong>Persuasion is not about picking the highest number, it's about who you're up against, what you look like, what your reputation is... For example, threatening a bunch of thugs with violence alone is usually pointless. Just like claiming to be a nobleman when you have straw sticking out of your shoes.

Persuasion is not about picking the highest number, it's about who you're talking to, what you look like, what your reputation is. For example, threatening a bunch of thugs with violence alone is usually pointless, just like claiming to be a nobleman with straw sticking out of your boots.
Outnumbered is unpleasant and best avoided. However, if you have to fight multiple opponents, try to keep them in front of you and move so that your aim interferes with the others.

Fighting against greater numbers is an unpleasant situation to be in, and is best avoided. However, if you have no other choice, try to keep your enemies in front of you, so that your opponent gets in the way of the others.
With both simple and perfect blocks, you deflect attacks from all opponents in front of you, not just the one you're aiming at.
Using simple and perfect blocks, you can defend against attacks from all opponents in front of you, not just the one you're locked on to.
Jumping sideways or backwards is good for moving quickly. How far you jump depends on your agility and the weight of the armor you're wearing.
Dodging sideways or backwards is a good way to move around quickly. How far you dodge depends on your Agility level and the weight of the armour you're wearing.

In the picture you can see the odds against the player. If you now step to the right, the opponents on the left will have to go around their teammate, giving you some time to deal with the first opponent.

While sneaking, you can distract enemies by throwing stones. If the enemy hears it, he will go and have a look.
While sneaking, you can distract enemies by throwing stones. If the enemy hears it, he will go and have a look.

After crouching, it is possible to attract the enemy to you by a weak whistle. If the enemy hears it, he will follow the sound.
 
Whistling after crouching will not summon a horse or dog.

While sneaking, you can distract enemies by whistling. If an enemy hears it, he will follow the sound.

There are two crucial stats if you want to go unnoticed. Their values and descriptions can be found in the apse in the Player tab.
 
determines how distinctive your appearance is and how quickly you are recognized.
 
determines how far away you are noticed.
 
For example, if you wear a clown outfit, you will be highly visible and very noticeable.

There are two crucial stats if you want to go unnoticed. Their values and descriptions can be found in the Player Menu in the Player tab.
 
determines how much you stand out and how quickly you are recognized.
 
determines the distance you can be seen from.
 
For example, if you wear a jester's outfit, you will be highly visible and very conspicuous.

Sneaking is a great way to avoid being seen or heard, but it's not always effective. If you hide in the shadows at night, you most likely won't be seen. But if you sneak around the town square in the middle of the day, you're more likely to cause a commotion.
 
People can hear and see you – you'll be easier to recognize at a distance if you're wearing distinctive clothing, and people are more likely to hear you if you're wearing clanging metal armour.

Sneaking is a great way to avoid being seen or heard, but it's not always effective. If you hide in the shadows at night, you most likely won't be seen. But if you sneak around the town square in the middle of the day, you're more likely to cause a commotion.
 
Remember: people can hear and see you – you'll be easier to recognize at a distance if you're wearing distinctive clothing, and people are more likely to hear you if you're wearing clanging metal armour.

If you sneak up to an enemy from behind, you can stealthily knock them out or kill them. Henry will be able to knock down enemies from the start, but to kill them, he will need to be equipped with a dagger.

If you sneak up to an enemy from behind, you can stealthily knock them out or kill them. Henry will be able to knock out enemies from the start, but to kill them, he will need to be equipped with a dagger.

An unconscious person will eventually wake up and if they saw you attacking them, they will report it to the guards. If an unconscious person is found be someone else, they will be woken up immediately.
An unconscious person will eventually wake up, and if he saw you attack him, they will report it to the guards. If an unconscious person is found by someone else, they will be woken up immediately.

They have guard dogs at some homes and if you wander into their yard, they will bark at you. That'll call the owner. If you attack them, or their owner, the dog will join the fight.
 
If you need to calm the guard dog down, try throwing some meat at it. I'm sure he won't refuse.

Some houses have guard dogs and if they catch you wandering around their property, they'll bark at you, alerting their owner. If you attack them or their owner, the dog will join the fight.
 
If you need to calm a guard dog down, try throwing it some meat. They surely won't turn it down.

allow you to knock out your victim without killing them.
 
allow you to quickly and quietly kill your victim if you have a dagger equipped.

Mutt will behave according to your commands. Free will allow Mutt to go about his business. He will also join you in combat and assist you as needed. If you want to know what's going on in the area or find out if anyone needs your help, it's best to ask the local innkeeper, who's sure to know all the gossip.

If you're interested in gambling, you can play dice in some roadside camps and every respectable tavern.

Alchemy is a handy skill that turns herbs and other ingredients into useful potions. To brew potions, you'll need a recipe, an alchemy table and the right ingredients.
Alchemy is a handy skill that turns herbs and other ingredients into useful potions. To brew potions, you'll need a recipe, an alchemy bench and the right ingredients.
If you commit a lot of theft and violent crimes in an area, people may start to take up arms or even call in help from the guards.

Bleeding injuries must be quickly bandaged, or you risk bleeding out.

If you equip a freshly stolen item, its rightful owner or those close to them might notice it on you and accuse you of theft.

If you have a damaged chopping weapon, you can sharpen it yourself on a grinding wheel, which you can find at any smithy.

Life is God's gift and combat doesn't always have to end in death! If your opponent surrenders, the honourable response is to accept and let him live.
Life is God's gift and combat doesn't always have to end in death! If your opponent surrenders, the honourable response is to accept and let him live.
Some disputes can be settled without getting the bailiff or guards involved. If your victim tries to reason with you, you have the option to surrender and resolve things without any further harm.
Some disputes can be settled without getting the bailiff or guards involved. If your victim tries to reason with you, you have the option to surrender and resolve things without any further harm.
In order to succesfully rob someone, you'll have to get into their purse or pouch without being seen. These are commonly worn hung from the belt.

If you want to store an item for later, you can use the chest near your assigned or rented bed. The contents of this chest is shared between all personal chests.

Within the Codex tab of your inventory, you can find all sorts of interesting information about the world around you.

If you want to sell stolen goods, you'll have to find a fence. Rumour has it millers are involved in all sorts of shady business.

When brewing potions, it's best to follow the recipe closely. In your list of recipes, you can quickly prepare all necessary ingredients onto the alchemy table.

While you can surely handle a blade, its important to keep improving your skills. You can find teachers in the world who can initiate you into advanced techniques.

If you find yourself heavily outnumbered, the best option may be "run away – live to fight another day". You can always come back when you're more skilled at combat, more stealthy or fortified with potions.

If you find yourself heavily outnumbered, the best option may be "run away – live to fight another day". You can always come back when you're more skilled at combat, more stealthy or fortified with potions.
If you've severely damaged your reputation, you can deicde to visit a priest and set out on a penitential pilgrimage. Alternatively, can pay an indulgence at the church or Rathaus.
If you've severely damaged your reputation, you can decide to visit a priest and set out on a penitential pilgrimage. Alternatively, you can purchase an indulgence at a church or Rathaus.

Even if you don't get caught red-handed, people may still deduce that you're the one that stole from them. If someone catches you sneaking around their home, they'll likely make sure none of their belongings are missing.

There are big differences between horses. A new one costs a lot, but it's a worthwhile investment – not just to get around faster, but also to carry a heavier load.

Even your finest clothing can lose it's charm if hidden beneath battered armour or a layer of dirt and blood.

Even if you don't get caught red-handed committing a crime, that doesn't mean you're safe. For example: if someone catches you on their property before finding a corpse, they'll deduce you're the killer and report you to the guards.

Even if you don't get caught red-handed committing a crime, that doesn't mean you're safe. For example: if someone catches you on their property before finding a corpse, they'll deduce you're the killer and report you to the guards.
Every failed haggling means the loss of your reputation with the merchant. But if you leave the merchant some extra coin, your reputation will improve.
Every unsuccessful bout of haggling lowers your reputation with the trader. On the contrary, if you leave the trader some extra coin, your reputation will improve.
If you have a good reputation in an area, people will pay less attention to you and will be more likely to overlook criminal activity.
If you have a good reputation in an area, people will pay less attention to you and will be more likely to overlook criminal activity.
When you're crouching, you're less visible, quieter, and it will take people longer to notice you.
When crouching, you're less visible, quieter, and it will take people longer to notice you.
Your equipment makes noise when you move and affects how loud your footsteps are. The surface you walk on and how fast you're moving also affects how loud you are.

You'll be harder to spot at a distance at night.

A horse's value isn't always the same as its price. Your relationship with the seller plays a role in whether he'll give you a discount or rack up the price.

People will be wary of you if they see you sneaking around or with a weapon in hand.

Whistling for your horse is loud, and can attract unwanted attention. If you whistle while crouching, instead of a whistle, you'll make more of an inconspicuous sound you can use to intentionally attract someone nearby.

Throwing stones will only attract people if they didn't see your throw it and they're close enough to hear the sound. If you throw stones directly at people, you'll make them mad, and they'll want to punish your for it.

Be careful what you consume. If you eat or drink something spoiled, you risk poisoning, which is indicated by the icon next to your health bar. It can only be cured with a Stomach Decoction.

Your character gets tired over time and then it needs to rest. Higher rest is better and can be depleted by combat, movement, eating some meals and basically just by being awake. Too much fatigue will weaken your character physically and can lead to fainting or death from exhaustion.

To prevent this, you need to get a good night's sleep from time to time and the better the quality of the bed you choose, the faster you will recover fully. Occasionally, fatigue can be delayed by drinking alcohol, for example, but beware, drinking too much will make you all the more exhausted.

Your character gets tired over time and then needs to rest. The more you are rested, the better. Rest is depleted by combat, movement, eating certain foods and basically just by being awake. Too much fatigue will weaken your character physically and can lead to fainting or death from exhaustion.

To prevent this, you need to get a good night's sleep from time to time and the better the quality of the bed you choose, the faster you will recover fully. Occasionally, fatigue can be delayed by drinking alcohol, for example, but beware, drinking too much will make you all the more exhausted.

Health determines how well your body is able to function. Its maximum level is fixed and cannot be increased, it can be temporarily reduced due to negative effects such as hunger or fatigue.

You can lose health due to poisoning, bleeding, falling from heights and especially from injuries in combat. Therefore, it is wise to invest in quality armor and especially helmets.

Health does not restore itself and injuries need to be actively treated. This can be done with an alchemical potion, some food and water. However, the best way to heal is through the care of the lazabitches or a good night's sleep. Bleeding wounds should also be treated with a bandage.

Health determines how well your body is able to function. Its maximum level is fixed and cannot be increased, it can be temporarily reduced due to negative effects such as hunger or fatigue.

You can lose health due to poisoning, bleeding, falling from heights and especially from injuries in combat. Therefore, it is wise to invest in quality armour and especially helmets.

Health does not restore itself and injuries need to be actively treated. This can be done with an alchemical potion, some food and water. However, the best way to heal is through the care of the bathwenches or a good night's sleep. Bleeding wounds should also be treated with a bandage.

Your body needs to eat and drink to keep its satiety high because it decreases over time. If it drops too much, hunger begins to have negative effects on your physical abilities, and it is possible to starve to death.

Every food and drink, including alchemical potions, has a certain level of satiety, and you cannot drink and eat endlessly. In addition, overeating also has a negative effect. Besides, beware, as food spoils over time, ingesting spoiled food will give you poisoning.

So make sure you always have some fresh or non-perishable supplies with you, and be sure to eat properly when visiting an inn.

Your character needs to eat and drink to keep his satiety high because it decreases over time. If it drops too much, hunger begins to have negative effects on your physical abilities, and you may even starve to death.

Each food and drink, including alchemical potions, has a certain level of satiety, and you cannot drink and eat endlessly. In addition, overeating also has a negative effect. You must also beware, as food spoils over time and ingesting spoiled food will cause you poisoning.

So make sure you always have some fresh or non-perishable supplies with you, and be sure to eat properly when visiting an inn.

<heading>Hetman</heading><paragraph>Originally the commander in some armed forces, with a rank equivalent to Captain. Later on the role became that of a civic Governor, selected from amongst the local nobility, who represented the monarch in a given territory.</paragraph> <heading>Hofmeister</heading><paragraph>From the German <italic>Hof</italic> meaning a court or manor, a hereditary office at the Royal Court. He was responsible for management of the Court.</paragraph> <heading>Under-Chamberlain</heading><paragraph>Along with the Chancellor, the Under-Chamberlain (in Latin Subcamerarius) was a member of the office represented the sovereign in the royal cities, such as proto-notaries or notaries.</paragraph> <heading>Burgrave</heading><paragraph>The representative of the sovereign and representative of provincial officials, of knightly status. His duties included management of the city and leading the army when needed.</paragraph>

<heading>Hetman</heading><paragraph>Originally a commander in certain armed forces, with a rank equivalent to Captain. Later on the role became that of a civic Governor, selected from amongst the local nobility, who represented the monarch in a given territory.</paragraph> <heading>Hofmeister</heading><paragraph>From the German <italic>Hof</italic> meaning a court or manor, a hereditary office at the Royal Court, responsible for management of the Court.</paragraph> <heading>Under-Chamberlain</heading><paragraph>Along with the Chancellor, the Under-Chamberlain (in Latin Subcamerarius) was a member of the office such as the protonotary or notaries who represented the monarch in royal cities.</paragraph> <heading>Burgrave</heading><paragraph>A representative of the monarch and head of provincial officials of knightly status. His duties included management of the city and leading the army when necessary.</paragraph>

<paragraph>They arose in the vicinity of every major building and supported stonemasons, carpenters, masons, blacksmiths, carters, stone breakers, rope makers, sawyers, coopers and the like. Subsidiary non-specialised work was done by the labourers. The production of stone or wooden elements or auxiliary structures took place directly at the smelter site. The site on which the smelter stood was called the building yard. The craftsmen often used specialised tools such as wooden hoists, gates, pulleys and slewing cranes, powered by hand or by large tread wheels.</paragraph><paragraph> Quite a number of people worked in the smelter, among whom natural and informal ties were formed. The mill also provided plenty of customers for the surrounding vendors, tavern keepers, and crofters, and most of the employees stayed overnight in the area. Its manager was the hutmaster - he allocated tasks, managed the building process and dealt with the patron (sponsor) of the building.</paragraph>

<paragraph>Workshops sprang up around every major construction site and employed stonemasons, stonedressers, carpenters, blacksmiths, carters, rope makers, sawyers, coopers and the like. Unskilled work was done by day labourers. Stone or wooden elements and auxiliary structures were manufactured directly at the works on site, known as the construction yard. The craftsmen often used specialised tools such as wooden hoists, winches, pulleys and rotating cranes, powered by hand or by large tread wheels.</paragraph><paragraph>Quite a number of people worked in construction, among whom natural and informal bonds were formed. The workshop also provided plenty of customers for the surrounding vendors, innkeepers and merchants, and most of the employees stayed overnight in the area. The workshop was run by a master builder who allocated tasks, managed the building process and dealt with the patron (sponsor) of the building.</paragraph>
